column2: ENGLISH
Visit the Tomb of Thorin Oakenshield
column3: Se rendre sur la Tombe de Thorin Ecu-de-Chne

column2: Go to visit the Tomb of Thorin Oakenshield, the dwarf who died to regain the Arkenstone, the Heart of the Mountain.
The Tomb of Thorin
You decided to visit the Tomb of Thorin Oakenshield, who led the Quest of Erebor before his death on the Batlle of the Five Armies. What will you do?
column3: Vous vous rendez sur la tombe de Thorin Ecu-de-Chne, qui mena l'Expedition d'Erebor avant d'tre tu lors de la Bataille des Cinq Armes. Qu'allez-vous faire?

column2: I'll meditate on his fate.
column3: Je vais mditer sur son destin.

column2: I could take the Arkenstone
I could take Orcrist, maybe?
Time of Meditation
You kneel in front of the tomb, and meditate a long time about the fate of Thorin Oakenshield. He was brave, but the Arkenstone made his mind crazy at the end
column3: Vous vous agenouillez face  la tombe de Thorin Ecu-de-Chne, et vous mditez longuement sur son destin. Il tait brave, mais l'Arkenstone a rendu son esprit malade  la fin

column2: He could have been a great King
column3: Il aurait pu tre un grand Roi

column2: You just got married, and there is a tradition among your people to take only one spouse during his life. Will you unite your soul to your spouse?
column3: Vous venez de vous marier, et il est de tradition parmi votre peuple de ne prendre qu'une pouse au cours de sa vie. Allez-vous unir votre me  votre conjoint?

column2: I truly love her!
This is just a wife.
Resource Discovered
After wandering the land and sampling the rocks found within the earth of [Root.Location.GetName], you've finally found evidence of an abundant source of high-quality iron ore!
After wandering the land and sampling the rocks found within the earth of [Root.Location.GetName], you've finally found evidence of a great chamber of magma, lying dormant within a local mountain!
After wandering the land and sampling the rocks found within the earth of [Root.Location.GetName], you've finally found evidence of an abundant source of high-quality copper ore!
After wandering the land and sampling the rocks found within the earth of [Root.Location.GetName], you've finally found evidence of an abundant source of tin ore!
After wandering the land and sampling the rocks found within the earth of [Root.Location.GetName], you've finally found evidence of a potential source of high-quality building stone!
After wandering the land and sampling the rocks found within the earth of [Root.Location.GetName], you've finally found evidence of a large vein of gold ore!
After wandering the land and sampling the rocks found within the earth of [Root.Location.GetName], you've finally found evidence of a large vein of silver ore!
After wandering the land and sampling the rocks found within the earth of [Root.Location.GetName], you've finally found evidence of a large vein of gemstones!
After wandering the land and sampling the rocks found within the earth of [Root.Location.GetName], you've finally found evidence of a high-quality source of lapis!
After wandering the land and sampling the rocks found within the earth of [Root.Location.GetName], you've finally found evidence of a vast deposit of high-quality salt!
My lord will be pleased.
Survey Successful

After wandering the land and sampling the rocks found within the earth of [From.Location.GetName], your loremaster [From.GetFirstName] finally found evidence of an abundant source of high-quality iron ore!

After wandering the land and sampling the rocks found within the earth of [From.Location.GetName], your loremaster [From.GetFirstName] finally found evidence of a great chamber of magma, lying dormant within a local mountain!

After wandering the land and sampling the rocks found within the earth of [From.Location.GetName], your loremaster [From.GetFirstName] finally found evidence of an abundant source of high-quality copper ore!
After wandering the land and sampling the rocks found within the earth of [From.Location.GetName], your loremaster [From.GetFirstName] finally found evidence of an abundant source of tin ore!

After wandering the land and sampling the rocks found within the earth of [From.Location.GetName], your loremaster [From.GetFirstName] finally found evidence of a potential source of high-quality building stone!
After wandering the land and sampling the rocks found within the earth of [From.Location.GetName], your loremaster [From.GetFirstName] finally found evidence of a large vein of gold ore!
After wandering the land and sampling the rocks found within the earth of [From.Location.GetName], your loremaster [From.GetFirstName] finally found evidence of a large vein of silver ore!
After wandering the land and sampling the rocks found within the earth of [From.Location.GetName], your loremaster [From.GetFirstName] finally found evidence of a large vein of gemstones!
After wandering the land and sampling the rocks found within the earth of [From.Location.GetName], your loremaster [From.GetFirstName] finally found evidence of a high-quality source of lapis!
After wandering the land and sampling the rocks found within the earth of [From.Location.GetName], your loremaster [From.GetFirstName] finally found evidence of a vast deposit of high-quality salt!
Great news!
Imprisoned

You were very absorbed in your work, picking through the earth and identifying ores. So absorbed were you, that some wretched orcs were able to sneak up behind you and strike first.  After a brief exchange of blows, you were taken alive.
Curses!
Loremaster Arrested
Your loremaster, [From.GetFirstName], has been captured by orcs in [From.Location.GetName] while surveying the land for you!
Cursed beasts!
A Snooping Dwarf

Your guard has discovered a Dwarven intruder snooping around in the caves and hills of [From.Location.GetName]. After a brief skirmish with the stubborn creature, he was captured and awaits your mercy in the dungeons...
Good! There are no riches for you here, wretched beardling.
Dwarven Survey

Rumor has reached your eyes from the Dwarf-Road. It would seem that a surveyor under the employ of [From.Liege.GetTitledName] has discovered a valuable source of mineral wealth beneath the earth in your province of [From.Location.GetName].
They want it? They may come and try taking it!
Ah, good. This wealth will be ours to share in.
Does this mean that more dwarves are coming?

There's talk in the local guild halls of a party of ambitious pioneers, miners, and migrants looking for a patron to help them embark on a mining expedition into the wilderness. Investments such as these are risky, but often very rewarding...
I'll see if my lord is interested...
Don't we have enough mines already?
A New Fortress

Your [From.GetJobTitle] [From.GetFirstName] has approached you with news of a small group of ambitious dwarf pioneers, miners, and migrants from the realm who wish to found a colony in the wilderness of [target_mining_target.GetName], and strike the earth in search of unfound riches. Once embarked, they will build a subterranean fortress in the stone, hopefully the foundation of a new dwarf-hold and a return on the investment. They are in need of a sponsor to purchase some expensive supplies and an expedition leader to wield authority.
I shall fund their expedition!
Well, good luck with finding them.
I shall lead them personally!
Why don't you go in my stead, [From.GetFirstName]?

My lord [From.GetFirstName] has asked me to find a group of adventurous pioneers willing to journey for fame and fortune in unclaimed lands, beneath untapped hills, cliffs, and mountains. The guild halls these days are fair teeming with greedy prospectors and unemployed miners who would certainly jump at the opportunity to liven things up and make a nugget or two of gold.
Let's see what tunnel rats I can flush out...
My lord, I will do some investigating and return to you with any volunteers that I can muster. There are seldom a dearth of greedy, stir-crazy dwarves around here.
Make it so.

My lord, I gravely apologize, but there don't seem to be enough volunteers interested in a mining venture. It seems that most of [Root.Capital.GetName]'s adventurous prospectors left for the last colony we founded.
Seriously!?

My lord, I gravely apologize, but there don't seem to be enough volunteers interested in a mining venture. It seems that nobody beleives that there are any unoccupied lands left in this corner of Middle-Earth worth mining. Perhaps consider a military expedition instead?
Perhaps I will...
A New Fortress

Your [From.GetJobTitle] [From.GetFirstName] has returned to you with volunteers for the quest. A small band of ambitious dwarf pioneers from the realm are willing to take the journey to found a new mining colony in search of unexplored wonders and untapped resources. From the guild halls, the drinking halls, and all manner of other, er, halls they come, with one common purpose - adventure.  And fame and fortune, of course, but that's not what matters. This group is a motley crew of tough dwarven entrepreneurship at its finest... it is, however, in need of an expedition leader.
I do suppose that I should hire a leader as well.
They'll need to pick one from amongst themselves.
I shall lead them personally!
Why don't you go in my stead, [From.GetFirstName]?
The mining company is assembled, the pickaxes sharpened and the ox-cart's axles greased up. With a twinkle in their eyes, the colonists ask where you plan on sending them.
Unpeopled wilderness is our safest choice.
You send the company to the [This.Holder.GetFirstName] of [This.GetName]
The sparesly peopled mountains of the North hold great promise.
You send the company to [This.GetName]
We shall claim a place where we know there are riches, occupied or not!
You send the company to [This.GetName], in the lands of [This.Holder.GetTitledName]
Actually, I've changed my mind...
You cancel the expedition
The colonists have left for [target_mining_target.GetName]. Time will tell whether or not the expedition results in financial gain.
I hope this doesn't end in disaster...

You have left for [target_mining_target.GetName], a long road ahead with good company and a promise of future wealth. You find yourself very glad that you decided to supervise this investment yourself.
Ah, I do love a good adventure.

column1: # The company arrives, you see them off.

column2: Since arriving in [target_mining_target.GetName], the company has dismantled the ox cart and begun the long process of digging into the cliffside of the most promising hill.  As a gate is cobbled together from the cart bottom and the first meeting area dug out, you nod in satisfaction and begin the journey home on your pony.  Next spring, you will send a resupply caravan to trade for the riches the brave dwarves find beneath the earth.
Have Fun you all!

It's been a year since the mining colony in [target_mining_target.GetName] was established, and the resupply caravan you arranged for is ready. The great ox-drawn wagon is filled with necessities to be traded with the pioneers for whatever riches they are sure to have drawn up from the earth. The broker and guard captain assigned to the caravan are among the best, the guildmaster assures you.
I'm coming with you. Let's go!
I cannot afford to be away from court right now. Good luck!
I eagerly await news.
The Caravan Arrives

After a long journey you approach [target_mining_target.GetName]. The exterior of the place is littered with the bones of dead orcs and an enormous pile of unidentifiable refuse lies adjacent to the closed drawbridge. Hailing the gatekeeper produces no reply.\n\nTaking the hidden door common to most fortresses, you emerge in the empty halls amid a grisly revelation.  The colonists must have been starving when struggling through the winter, for they apparently butchered and ate each other! Those who survived this horror likely starved to death anyways, as there are no survivors to be found.
These idiots couldn't farm mushrooms?

After a long journey you approach [target_mining_target.GetName]. The exterior of the place is littered with the bones of dead orcs and an enormous pile of unidentifiable refuse lies adjacent to the closed drawbridge. Hailing the gatekeeper produces no reply.\n\nTaking the hidden door common to most fortresses, you emerge in the halls amid a disturbing revelation. It appears as though the colonists all went mad and murdered each other!  If there were survivors they fled into the wilderness. Naught walks the halls now but an unusually large number of cats.
They must have run out of beer.

After a long journey you approach [target_mining_target.GetName]. The exterior of the place is littered with the bones of dead orcs… and are those the bones of dwarves? As you hail the gatekeeper, the fortress’s sturdy drawbridge begins to lower.\n\nWith a sinking feeling, you realize that the multitude of figures emerging from the entrance are not the pioneers, but orcs!
Drop the wagon and run for your lives!
Draw your axes! Khazâd ai-mênu!

After a long journey you approach [target_mining_target.GetName]. The exterior of the place is littered with the bones of dead orcs and an enormous pile of unidentifiable refuse lies adjacent to the drawbridge entrance. A moat beneath the bridge is filled with stinking viscera.\n\nShrugging off this unpleasant welcome, you greet the filthy, wild-eyed mayor of the new fortress and eagerly ask to see what wealth they have to trade. As the caravan settles into their ramshackle trade post, you find yourself greeted by racks upon racks of cat-leather socks, roughly carved limestone mugs, and cumbersome stone slabs.
Let’s just give them their provisions and get out of here.
If they don’t have anything to trade, they can’t have our food.

After a long journey you approach [target_mining_target.GetName]. The exterior of the place is littered with various kinds of neatly sorted industrial and agricultural refruse. You cross the moat into the well-fortified entryway and begin unloading your wares in the fortress's spacious trade post.\n\nThe mayor of the fortress greets you, gives requests for future supplies, and presents you with a broker. The broker-dwarf has haulers produce various gems, precious metal bars, and crafts of middling to fine craftsdwarfship. It seems that they have done well for themselves in their new home.
Let’s do some business!
The food is yours, my friends. Reinvest your newfound wealth!

After a long journey you approach [target_mining_target.GetName]. Although it’s hardly been a year, the colonists have already constructed enormous statues of you flanking a grand entrance framed by smooth granite walls. The colonists, together with a horde of new migrants and laughing children, come running out of the fortress to greet their [Root.GetTitle].\n\nAfter exchanging niceties, your caravan enters the fortress, and you admire the carefully smoothed and ornately engraved walls of the hallway. The trading post is stacked with riches - gem-encrusted gold jewelry, superior weaponry, and masterfully crafted steel mechanisms!
I am without words!
The mayor of the new colony in [target_mining_target.GetName] has met with your liason. If you wish, it could be elevated to a full Barony, the mayor made a lord of the realm under your vassalhood.
Of course! They are a welcome addition to the mountain-homes.
Maintaining such a distant colony will be impractical.

column1: # You gain a new barony in your demesne

column2: The mayor of the new colony in [target_mining_target.GetName] has met with your liason. The title paperwork is ready - it is time for your investment to become a new part of your demesne.
May it grow to be an important part of the realm.

The mining venture to [target_mining_target.GetName] was a total failure. Either you or one of the other supposed professionals involved in this venture made some serious mistakes which cost the realm. Many dwarven lives, and your entire investment, have been lost.
May the Maker keep their souls.
The guilds will pay for this!
Vengeance must be ours!

Word has reached your ears of an adventurous band of dwarves from the realm of [From.Realm.GetName] travelling in search of a new mine-home within the borders of [target_mining_target.GetName]. Their expedition leader seeks your leave to cross your marches in order to settle some barren hill far from any [Root.Religion.GetName] settlements.
May they find what they seek, I suppose.
Intriguing... perhaps we can make a business arrangement.
They do not have my leave and I intend to stop them.

Word has reached your ears of an adventurous band of dwarves from the realm of [From.Realm.GetName] who have walled themselves in a barren hill somewhere in the remote areas of [target_mining_target.GetName].  There they craft items of untold power and value and dig up from the earth what is rightfully yours...
They can keep what I do not need.
We shall see how long they last against my vile force of darkness!
These greedy creatures would perhaps accept a bribe to join our cause.
The mining venture to [target_mining_target.GetName] was a success. A new foothold for Dwarvendom in Beleriand has been established, and you have made a return on your investment.
Excellent.
Reinvest it with the guilds!

The mining venture to [target_mining_target.GetName] was a great success! A great vein of mineral wealth has been found, and settlers flood the site in a rush to make their fortune. Your investment has made returns beyond your greatest expectations.
I'm rich!
Let's pay it forward for the guilds and the pioneers!

The mining venture to [target_mining_target.GetName] was not much of a success. Some wealth has been obtained by the struggling settlers, but overall it does not seem as though the cost was worth it. The miners have begun to return and few new adventurers can be convinced to go. You'll need to eat your investment.
Very well, we can't win them all.
Let's double down. Things will turn around!
The guilds have mismanaged my funds. They shall pay for the losses.
The mining venture to [target_mining_target.GetName] was a total failure. The settlers were unable to make it through tough times, and the few survivors abandoned the site.
May the Maker keep their souls.
The guilds will pay for this!

The mining venture to [target_mining_target.GetName] was destroyed. A local lord stormed the fortress when its location was discovered, and your investment has been seized by the invaders. Your gamble ended in catastrophe.
This is my doing - I sent them into danger.
They have become an enemy of the Dwarves!

The mining venture to [target_mining_target.GetName] was destroyed. Orcs stormed the fortress when its location was discovered, the dwarves within murdered in various horrible ways, their flesh devoured and their homes defiled. Your gamble ended in catastrophe.
This is my doing - I sent them into danger.
One day, we will have our vengeance.

After a long journey you approach where you recall [target_mining_target.GetName] being. You are stopped at the fortress bridge by [target_mining_target.Religion.GetName] guards, and you can see [target_mining_target.Religion.GetName] people milling around the ruins of the mine.  As your companions begin to bellow for an explanation, [target_mining_target.County.Holder.GetTitledName] appears by the guards to address you. "Hello there, [Root.GetFirstName].", [target_mining_target.County.Holder.GetSheHe] sneers. "Perhaps from now on you will think twice before invading foreign lands."
Damn! We have been bested.
We will take it back from you dwarf-slaying monsters!
The mining venture to [target_mining_target.GetName] was a success. A new foothold for Dwarvendom in Beleriand has been established.
That's good to hear.
The mining venture to [target_mining_target.GetName] was a great success! A great vein of mineral wealth has been found, and settlers flood the site in a rush to make their fortune.
Excellent news.

The mining venture to [target_mining_target.GetName] was not much of a success. Some wealth has been obtained by the struggling settlers, but overall it does not seem as though the effort was worth it. The miners have begun to return and few new adventurers can be convinced to go.
Oh well.
The mining venture to [target_mining_target.GetName] was a total failure. The settlers were unable to make it through tough times, and the few survivors abandoned the site.
May the Maker keep their souls.

The mining venture to [target_mining_target.GetName] was destroyed. A local lord stormed the fortress when its location was discovered, and your investment has been seized by the invaders. Your gamble ended in catastrophe.
What terrible news.
They have become an enemy of the Dwarves!

The mining venture to [target_mining_target.GetName] was destroyed. Orcs stormed the fortress when its location was discovered, the dwarves within murdered in various horrible ways, their flesh devoured and their homes defiled. Your gamble ended in catastrophe.
What terrible news.
One day, we will have our vengeance.

Most esteemed [Root.GetRulerTitle] [Root.GetFirstName], we welcome you and your [From.Culture.GetName] kin to our land. We hope to share in the wealth that your skilled kin are sure to bring to our sleepy corner of the world.
Indeed!

Most esteemed [Root.GetRulerTitle] [Root.GetFirstName], your miners are not welcome to steal from my people in my lands. If you send them forth to delve a fortress within my borders, I shall drive them from the land and seize what is mine.
We will carry on with our expedition, threats or no.
...recall the miners.
Your latest missives have been turned back by orcs in the land of [target_mining_target.GetName]. It seems that your colonists have been bribed, and all defected to the Enemy.
Infamy! None must know of this.
Dwarf Colonist
This character has recently colonized new lands with dwarven mines.
Blamed the Guilds
This character blamed the guilds for a recent financial failure, forcing them to compensate for the losses.
